text: Still Life with a Guitar is an early 20th century painting by Spanish cubist Juan Gris. Done in oil on canvas, the work is in the collection of the Metropolitan Museum of Art, Gallery 905. The work was created in 1913 in the small Spanish town of Céret in the Pyrenees. Céret was popular with artists, including Picasso, who paid a visit there in the same year. == References == Category:1913 paintings Category:Paintings of the Metropolitan Museum of Art Category:Paintings by Juan Gris Category:Musical instruments in art
title: Still Life with a Guitar
